forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 13 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph.

weather_report:
As the sun prepares to retreat from the sky, Downtown San Francisco rests in a blanket of mostly cloudy skies, the horizon looming softly beneath a gentle whisper of wind. The air carries a coolness, a promise of the low to settle around fifty-four degrees, cradled by a west-southwest breeze that shifts with light, refreshing gusts. The evening feels intimate, encouraging a retreat into the warmth of a light jacket, perhaps layered over a sweater to embrace the dipping temperatures as the night wraps its arms around the city.

Come Sunday, the clouds will peel away to reveal a mostly sunny canvas, basking the day in soft light, though cool winds will mingle just enough to keep the warmth at bay, hovering around sixty-two degrees. As temperatures gently wane in the afternoon, the vibe invites leisurely explorations—perhaps a stroll along the shoreline, where the whispers of the ocean mingle with laughter from afar, or a visit to one of the local cafés, where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee dances with the last golden rays. The day may not be overtly warm, but it speaks to the spirit of exploration, urging one to dress in layers, to embrace the balance of comfort and style, with a touch of adventure in the air.
